en: Crocodiles continually grow new sets of teeth to replace old ones.
Squirrels can climb trees faster than they can run on the ground.
Giraffes can't swim.
Ferrets sleep between 18 - 20 hours a day.
Horses have 18 more bones than humans.
There are over 40,000 muscles tendons in an elephant's trunk.
When baby polar bear cubs are born they cannot see or hear for their first month.
Cats can't move their jaw sideways.
The skeleton of an African elephant accounts for about 15% of its body weight.
Research has shown that domestic cats never forgive. They fail to show signs of reconciliation like other animals do.
It takes 1 alligator to make a pair of shoes and 3 for a pair of boots.
Elephants communicate in sound waves below the frequency that humans can hear.
All snakes are carnivorous.
Domestic cats dislike citrus scents.
Porcupines float in water.
The only continent without reptiles or snakes is Antarctica.
The African Rock Python can survive 2 years without eating.
Elephants ears are used to regulate body temperature.
You can tell the sex of a horse by its teeth (most males have 40, females 36).
Elephants sleep between 4 - 5 hours in 24 period.
Tigers are the only predators known to regularly prey on adult bears
Hippophobia is the fear of horses.
There are no wild tigers in Africa. Only in Asia.
The night vision of tigers is 6 times better than humans.
Camels are born without humps.
Cheetahs can accelerate from 0 to 70 km/h (43mp/h) in 3 seconds.
Baby rattlesnakes are born in August and September.
Koalas sleep around 18 hours a day.
The cheetah is the only cat that can't retract it's claws.
Frogs can't swallow with their eyes open.
Hippopotamuses are born under water.
Bull's can run faster uphill than down.
Chameleons can move their eyes in two directions at the same time.
An ostrich's eye is bigger than its brain.
A camel can shut its nostrils during a desert sandstorm.
Many animals have been reported to commit suicide, including dogs, cows, bulls, and sheep.
White cats with blue eyes are usually deaf.
Bats are the only mammals that fly.
Crocodiles are color blind.
Moths have white blood.
Spiders have transparent blood.
Giraffes have no vocal cords.
Horses sleep standing up.
Female condors lays a single egg once every 2 years.
Most cows produce more milk when they listen to music.
More people are allergic to cows milk than any other food.
The smallest dog is the Chihuahua.
No two spider webs are the same.
When 2 zebras stand side by side they usually face each other in opposite directions to keep an eye out for predators.
Only pregnant females polar bears hibernate.
A male baboon can kill a leopard.
Elephants can run up to 40kmh (25mph).
Zebras are actually black, with white stripes
A rat can tread water for 3 days.
A platypus can eat its weight in worms every day.
The Blue-ringed octopus is one of the world's most venomous marine animals: it can kill you in one bite, there is no antivenom.
Cows emit more methane than the oil industry and are a huge enor in global warming.
A cheetahs top speed is 114kph (70mph).
Gorillas sleep 14 hours a day.
An elephant's trunk can hold over 5 liters of water.
Humans can beat all animals in long-distance running.\n
A giraffe can clean its ears with its 21 inch (53 cm) tongue.
Ostriches have a 14 meter (46 foot) long small intestine.
A bear has 42 teeth.
Snakes can't bite in rivers or swamps (they would drown otherwise).
There are over 690 known species of bats.
A cat can keep purring while inhaling and exhaling.
Giraffes and rats can last longer without water than camels.
The tallest mammal is the giraffe.
March 14 is 'save a spider day'.
An iguana can stay under water for 28 minutes.
Herpetophobia is the fear of reptiles.
The average age of a polar bear in the wild is 17 years.
There are 70 million sheep in New Zealand (with 4 million people).
You can smell a skunk 1.6km (1 mile) away.
Toads only eat moving prey.
Cats spend 66% of their life asleep.
Rhinoceros have 3 toes on each foot.
The spikes of a newborn hedgehog begin to appear within 24 hours.
It takes 110 silkworm cocoons to make an average tie.
Camels have 3 eyelids to protect themselves from blowing sand.
Helminthophobia is the fear of worms.
You're more likely to be killed by a champagne cork than by a poisonous spider.
Pandas spend 12 hours a day eating bamboo.
Scorpions glow under ultra violet light.
60 cows can produce a ton of milk each day.
Your foot is the most common body part bitten by insects.
Camel's milk doesn't curdle.
Armadillos have 4 babies at a time and are all the same sex.
Most dinosaurs lived to be more than 100 years old.
Giraffes can't cough.
The Horse Head used in the movie "The Godfather" was real
Its physically impossible for pigs to look up at the sky.
A King Cobra is the biggest of all poisonous snakes and can grow to over 4 meters (13 feet) long.
Police dogs are trained to respond to commands in foreign languages (usually German or Hungarian).
Cats have a peripheral vision of 285 degrees.
Lion's can't roar until the age of 2.
There are more than 50 different kinds of kangaroos.
Deers don't like hay.
Cats can jump up to 7 times their tail length.
In 2011, a monkey was arrested in Pakistan for crossing the border with India
A bear in hibernation loses up to 25% of its body weight.
Crocodiles swallow rocks to help them dive deeper.
The lifespan of a squirrel is 9 years.
When born a baby giraffe is 1.8m (6ft) tall.
The stomach acids found in a snakes stomach can digest bones and teeth but not fur or hair.
Warthogs can reach a speed of 48km/h (29mph).
Hippopotamuses have killed more people in Africa than any other animal.
The mortality rate of a Black Mamba snake bite is almost 100%
A hippopotamus can run faster than a man.
Armadillos can walk underwater.
An arrow frog has enough poison to kill over 2,200 people.
A crocodile can't move its tongue.
The average cow produces 40 glasses of milk a day.
Giant tortoises can live in captivity longer than any other animal.
During the outbreak of WW2, London Zoo killed all their venomous animals in case the zoo was bombed and the animals escaped.
India has over 50 million monkeys.
A cat has 32 muscles in each ear.
Dinosaurs lived on Earth for over 165 million years before they became extinct.
Tarantula spiders can survive 2 and a half years without food.
Some dinosaurs had tails over 13m (45 feet) long.
Australia has the largest sheep population.
Lions in the wild usually make no more than 20 kills a year.
A lions feed once every 3 to 4 days.
Greyhounds can see better than any other dog breed.
Cows don't have upper front teeth.
At birth dalmations are always white.
House cats have 18 claws.
Hippopotamuses have skin 3.8cm (1.5in) thick.
Camels can drink 94 liters (25 gallons) of water in less than 3 minutes.
A lobsters blood is colorless but when exposed to oxygen it turns blue.
Japan is the largest exporter of frog legs.
Mosquitoes dislike citronella because it irritates their feet/
More people are killed by hippopotamuses then by lions, elephants and water buffalos combined.
Snakes can't blink.
Coconuts kill over 150 people each year (more than sharks).
India is home to over 200 million cows.
The fingerprints of koala bear are indistinguishable to that of a human.
Gatophobia is the fear of cats.
It's possible to lead a cow up stairs but not down.
The world's smallest mammal is the bumblebee bat of Thailand.
Polar bears are strictly carnivores.
There are giant carnivorous snails living in New Zealand.
Small dogs usually live longer than larger breeds.
Gorillas can't swim.
Cats have over 100 vocal chords.
Zoophobia is the fear of animals.
After bananas a zoo gorilla's favorite food is celery.
The tuatara, a New Zealand reptile that pre-dates the dinosaurs, has three eyes.
Warthogs live for 15 years.
In Africa more people are killed by crocodiles than lions.
\nLionesses find lions with darker manes more attractive
Dogs sweat through the pads on their feet.
Spiders are arachnids and not insects.
A cat uses its whiskers to determine if a space is too small to squeeze through.
Reindeer hair is hollow inside like a tube.
Frogs don't usually swallow water (they absorb most of the moisture they need through their skin).
Crocodiles are responsible for over a 1,000 deaths each year by the Banks of the Nile river.
Elephants are the only mammal that can't jump.
The bloodhound is the only animal whose evidence is admissible in an American court.
Manatees possess vocal chords which give them the ability to speak like humans, but don't do so because they have no ears with which to hear the sound.
The only domestic animal not mentioned in the Bible is the cat.
The chow-chow and the Chinesse Shar-Pei are the only dogs that have a black tongue. The tongues of all other dogs are pink.
When a female horse and male donkey mate, the offspring is called a mule, but when a male horse and female donkey mate, the offspring is called a hinny.
Tapeworms range in size from about 0.04 inch (0.1 cm) to more than 50 feet (1.5 m) in length.
Rabbits aren't rodents like most people think. They are actually Lagomorphs.
Australian brown snakes are highly dangerous and easily alarmed.
Contrary to popular belief, elephants are not afraid of mice, and they do not have any better memory than any other animal.
Contrary to popular belief, possums, squirrels, chipmunks, and mice do not carry rabies.
One reason that kittens sleep so much is because a growth hormone is released only during sleep.
A large male deer is often called stag.
Black mambas get their name because of the black color inside their mouth.
The diet of a panda is made up almost entirely of bamboo.
A chameleon's tongue is twice the length of its body.
Frogs cannot swallow without blinking.
Some insects, such as gerridae (water striders), are able to walk on the surface of water.
Scientists estimate that there are around 20000 polar bears.
The original name for the butterfly was flutterby.
The largest cockroach on record is one measured at 3.81 inches (10 cm) in length.
Animals will not eat another animal that has been hit by a lightning strike!
An elephant can be pregnant for up to two years.
Did you know that clown fish start off as males and later on in their lives develop into females?
Tigers not only have striped fur but they also have striped skin!
The ten most popular dogs (AKC, 2007) are in order: Labrador Retriever, Yorkshire Terrier, German Shepherd, Golden Retriever, Beagle, Boxer, Dachshund, Poodle, Shih Tzu, and Bulldog.
Remarkably, frogs actually use their eyes to help them swallow food.
The heaviest dog on record is an Old English Mastiff named Zorba, who weighed 343 pounds.
Koalas almost never drink water. They get fluids from the eucalyptus leaves they eat.
A species of earthworm in Australia grows up to 10 feet in length.
Scorpions can withstand 200 times more nuclear radiation than humans can.
Contrary to popular belief, dogs do not only sweat by salivating. They also sweat through the poors on their feet.
Lions are mainly nocturnal, so they sleep for about 20 hours every day.
American alligators live in south-eastern areas of the United States such as Florida and Louisiana.
Bulls are colorblind, it is the motion of the cape which angers them.
The Earthworm can clear and aerate half a pound of soil in a day. (There are, on average, 3 million worms per acre of fertile soil)
Did you know African elephants only have 4 teeth?

A snake has no ears. However, its tongue is extremely sensitive to sound vibrations, and by constantly flicking its tongue the snake picks up these sound waves. In this sense a snake hears with its tongue.
Elephants, lions, and camels roamed Alaska 12,000 years ago.
The roar of a lion can be heard from 8 kilometers (5.0 miles) away.
Did you know a group of kangaroos is called a mob?
Chipmunks are small squirrels with stripes.
Unlike most cats, tigers love the water and can easily swim three or four miles.
The sloth (a mammal) moves so slowly that green algae can grow undisturbed on its fur!
A snail can sleep for 3 years.
Pregnant female polar bears will not eat for several months while resting in her den under the snow.
Koala Bears are not bears.
Cats often rub up against people and furniture to lay their scent and mark their territory.
Cats sleep 16 to 18 hours per day.
Dogs have been man's pet for over 14,000 years.
Zebras are members of the horse genus.
A completely blind chameleon will still take on the colors of its environment.
The flying snake of Java and Malaysia is able to flatten itself out like a ribbon and sail like a glider from tree to tree.
Horses can't throw up.
Did you know the average elephant produces 50 pounds of dunn each day?
The hippopotamus is generally considered the third largest land mammal (after the White rhinoceros and elephant).
Rats can swim for a 1/2 mile without resting, and they can tread water for 3 days straight.
Chameleons have long tongues which they rapidly extend from their mouth, too fast for human eyes to see properly.
Rabbits live in groups.
Female pandas raise cubs on their own (the male leaves after mating).
Giraffes have the same number of vertebrae in their necks as humans. Their lips are prehensile.
The costliest cat ever is named Little Nicky, who cost his owner $50,000. He is a clone of an older cat.
Resting in water helps keep hippopotamuses temperature down.
Cows and horses sleep standing up.
Australia's box jellyfish has toxins more potent than the venom in cobras, and is one of the most dangerous jellyfish in the world
Did you know dogs sweat through the pads on their feet?
Lobsters do feel pain when boiled alive. By soaking them in salt water before cooking, however, you can anesthetize them.
The lifespan of a firefly is about seven days. During these days, they are busy trying to find a mate.
Flea's can jump 130 times higher than their own height. In human terms this is equal to a 6ft.
Mules are genetically sterile. i.e. they cannot reproduce.
Certain frogs can regurgitate their stomachs, in order to clean them.
The only insect that can turn its head 360 degrees is the praying mantis.
Rhinos are part of the same family as horses.
The Galapagos tortoise has the longest lifespan of any animal, up to 200 years.
Cats cannot taste sweet things.
The domestic cat is the only species able to hold its tail vertically while walking. Wild cats hold their tail horizontally, or tucked between their legs while walking.
Horses have bigger eyes than any other mammal that lives on land.
A cow gives nearly 200,000 glasses of milk in her lifetime.
No one has ever been able to domesticate the African Elephant. Only the Indian elephant can be trained by man.
The Giant South African Earthworm can grow up to 22 feet (6.7 m) long and 1 inch (2.5 cm) in thick.
German Shepherds bite humans more than any other breed of dog.
An electric eel can produce a shock of up to 650 volts.
More than 99.9 percent of all animal species that have ever lived on Earth were extinct before the coming of man.
Cats have a weak sense of taste. They have only 473 tastebuds, humans have 10,000.
Did you know most snakes have 1 lung?
The crocodile is a cannibal.
Approximate number of facial expressions dogs can make: 100.
A ribbon worm will eat themselves if they cannot find food. They can still survive after eating up to 95% of their body weight.
Bats are flying mammals.
There are around 40000 different species of spider.
Did you know there are more than 50 different kinds of kangaroos?
Only thirty percent of the famous Maryland blue crabs are actually from Maryland, the rest are from North Carolina and Virginia.
When cows lay down, they get up back feet first...so if you get enough people to sit on their rear end, they won't be able to stand again.
A cheetah has amazing eyesight during the day and can spot prey from 5 km away.
A cat has four rows of whiskers.
Kangaroos and emus cannot walk backwards, and are on the Australian coat of arms for that reason.
Other members of the arachnid family include scorpions, mites, ticks.
Spiders are not insects.
Zanzibar is the only place where you will find the Kirk's Red Colobus monkey.
Cat's urine glows under a blacklight.
Rabbits love licorice.
The average elephant weighs less than the average blue whale's tongue.
Crocodiles have the strongest bite of any animal in the world.
The Pygmy Marmoset is the smallest type of monkey, with adults weighing between 120 and 140 grams.
A snail can travel over a razor blade without cutting itself.
Koalas have twin thumbs.
If you cut off a snail's eye, it will grow a new one.
Greyhounds are not hyper and do not need constant exercise
The average housefly weighs 10 to 15 millionths of a pound.
Cows release 50 million metric tonnes of methane gas a year.
Male monkeys lose the hair on their heads the same way men do.
Cats have over one hundred vocal sounds. Dogs only have about 10.
Polar bears keep warm thanks to nearly 10 cm of blubber under the skin.
Did you know that crocodiles never outgrow the pool in which they live??
A newborn kangaroo is less than an inch (2.5 cm) long, and can fit into a teaspoon.
A rhinoceros horn is made of compacted hair.
The snail mates only once in it's entire life.
Tigers are good swimmers and can swim up to 6 kilometres.
Crocodiles can snap their jaws in 1/8th of a second and can use over 40 sets of teeth.
Dogs dont like rain because the sound is amplified and hurts their very sensitive ears.
Did you know the greyhound is the fastest dog and can reach a speed of up to 72kph (45mph)?
An adult porcupine has approximately 30,000 quills on its body, which are replaced every year.
A kangaroo cannot jump if its tail is lifted off the ground. It needs its tail for pushing off.
Cats that fall from higher than 7 stories get fewer injuries than those that fall from lower levels.
Leopards are so stealthy that they can roam around a city like Manhattan with the chances of not being seen.
Elephants, horses, and camels all descended from animals that originally came from North America, despite their present homes in Eurasia.
Every 9.6 years there is a peak in Canada's wildlife population, especially among muskrats, red fox, skunks, mink, lynx, and rabbits.
Deer take their first steps within half an hour of their birth.
Rabbits cannot vomit.
It may take more than two days for a chick to break out of its shell.

The upper and lower eyelids of chameleons are joined, leaving just a small hole for them to see through. They can move their eyes independently however, allowing them to look in two different directions at the same time.
The average hen lays 190 eggs per year.
Swan is one of several birds that have a penis.
The giraffe has the highest blood pressure.
Only dogs and men has the prostate.
The smartest dog is the border collie.
The most stupid dogs are considered to be Afghan hounds.
Lions can mate over 50 times a day.
A kangaroo rat doesn't drink water at all.
There is 5 times less fat in goat's milk than in cow's.
The biggest tigers are Siberian tigers. The height at the withers reaches 115 cm, maximum body length greater than 3 meters, maximum weight is 280 kg.
95% of all known living organisms on Earth are the invertebrates.
Scientists distinguish 1 100 000 species of arthropods, 24 500 species of fish, 9,000 species of mammals and birds, 8,000 reptiles, amphibians 5 000 and 260 000 species of plants.
Basenji is the only dog that cannot bark.
Owl does not digest fur, feathers and bones. She burps a few hours after eating.
A wounded or scared opossum falls dead, his eyes glaze over, mouth foam, and the anal glands the stench is exhaled. After the danger has passed, the opossum revives and recovers.
There  live 6 billion dust mites in your bed.
One third of all food on Earth eat insects.
The most stupid animal in Earth's history was stegosaurus. With body weight of 3 tons it had a brain the size of a walnut.
Sharks do not get sick.
The skeleton of sharks is made of cartilage that make up 60% of its weight.
The female North American opossum carries a child for 8 days
An Albatross can sleep in flight at the speed of 40 kilometers per hour.
A two-days old gazelle can accelerate to the speed of 95 kilometers per hour.
Blue whales are the loudest animals in the world. Their melodious singing can stun people.
People managed to take photo of a giant squid only in 2006. These half-ton monsters live at a depth of 200 meters to kilometer.
Termite mounds can be built for hundreds of years and reach 6 m in height.
The reproduction rate of rats is so high that under favorable circumstances, 2 rats could multiply to 1 million rats in a year and a half.
The caterpillar has 248 muscles in it's head.
A cow has 4 stomachs.
Squirrells are the best gardeners. Millions of trees grow because squirrels forget where they put nuts and seeds.
Shark changes teeth every 8 days. Shark's teeth are hard as steel, and are attached just in the gums.
An owl can rotate its head 360 degrees.
During the day, the chickadee feeds its chicks a thousand times.
There are about 500 zoos in the world.

Nowadays scientists know 7 organisms which don't grow old. They are:  the Aleutian rockfish, painted turtle, American bog turtle, Carolina box turtle, red sea urchin, clam ciprina Icelandic and ancient bristlecone pine.

The easiest way to distinguish the beast-vegetarian from predators: the predators eyes are located on the front of the muzzle to see the victim. Vegetarians' — on both sides of the head to see the enemy.
Penguins can jump up to a height of more than a meter and a half.
The word "orangutan" in some languages of Africa means "man of the jungle
Sloths spend 75% of their lives sleeping.
The French call a pigeon a "flying rat.
The ancient Egyptians taught baboons to serve them at the table.
Orangutans warn about the aggression with a loud burp.
The mole can dig a tunnel of 76 meters in one night.
You can make 11 portions of scrambled eggs from an ostrich egg.
The elephant is the only animal with 4 knees.
During the First world war, one of the South African monkeys received a medal and was even awarded a military rank corporal.
The weight of ostrich eggs can reach 1.5 kg.
Inside the lion's pride 9/10 of prey of the "family" is given to the lioness.
Giraffes have absolutely black tongue, the length of which can reach up to 45 cm.
Ostriches can outrun a horse.
Wild cobras can live up to 20 years.
A goat has a rectangular pupil.
A macaque monkey took a selfie that ended up on Wikipedia. Though the camera owner asked to have it taken down, claiming copyright infringement, Wikimedia disagreed and kept the photo up.
The lion's mane jellyfish is the largest species of jellyfish, reaching a width of 7.5 feet, with tentacles up to 121.4 feet long.
A typical used mattress contains from 100,000 to 10 million dust mites.
Sea otters sometimes hold hands while sleeping to keep from drifting apart.
Leaf insects take on the appearance of leaves, and even rock back and forth when walking, to mimic a real leaf being blown by the wind.
A blue whale's tongue can weigh as much as an elephant.
Dolphins have been trained to turn in trash in exchange for fish. One dolphin was smart enough to hide paper under a rock and tear off small pieces in order to get more fish.
The Japanese spider crab has a leg span of 12 feet from claw to claw.
Koshik, an Asian elephant from South Korea, mimics human speech. He can say "hello", "sit down", "no" and "good", in Korean.
A chicken loses feathers when it becomes stressed.
Birds have many bones that are hollow, which helps them fly.
Marine iguanas can stay underwater for up to 30 minutes.
In March 2018, the last male Northern White Rhinoceros died.
At birth, a panda weighs three to five ounces and is about 1/900th the size of its mother.
The world's fattest cat, Meow, weighed 39.6 pounds.
The smallest known chameleon, Brookesia micra, from the islet of Nosy Hara in Antsiranana, Madagascar, can grow up to 1.1 inches in length.
Clown fish start off as males and develop into females later on in their lives.
A hummingbird's eggs are pea sized. A newborn is about an inch long and weighs about one-third of a U.S. Dime.
Scientists have attached stilts to ants' legs to prove that ants reach their goal by counting their steps. Ants with stilts marched past their goal due to the new length of their stride.
Many animals swallow rocks, including chickens, penguins, crocodiles, and seals. Rocks that have been swallowed are called gastroliths, meaning "stomach stones".
In the U.S., about 1.2 million dogs and 1.4 million cats are euthanized (put to death) each year.
Some species of tapeworm, an intestinal worm that can infect humans, can grow to over 100 feet long.
Crickets taste like roast nuts, scorpions taste like shrimp, and some termites have a mint taste.
In some African countries, over 90% of the people eat moth and butterfly caterpillars.
Koalas rarely drink. They generally get enough fluids just from eating eucalyptus leaves.
The tongue-eating louse replaces a fish's tongue with itself. It actually becomes the fish's new tongue.
A number of TV stations provide television for dogs to watch.
Goldfish lose their color if they are kept in dim light or are placed in a body of running water, such as a stream.
Haggis pudding, the national dish of Scotland, is made of sheep's heart, liver and lungs, with onion, oatmeal, suet, and spices, encased in the animal's stomach.
Although hippos are very heavy animals, they can easily outrun most humans.
Scientists in South Korea have cloned cats that glow in the dark.
A traditional Sardinian, sheep's milk, cheese, Casu Marzu, contains deliberately introduced live maggots.
There are three types of land snakes on the island of Tasmania, all of which are venomous.
Humans have about 10,000 taste buds, but catfish have over 100,000, while chickens have only 24.
Lungfish can live out of water for up to four years in a state of suspended animation.
Bombardier beetles defend themselves by ejecting a boiling, foul-smelling liquid, which partially becomes gas, and is accompanied by a loud popping sound.
There are about three chickens for every human in the world.
Each year around 75 humans are attacked by sharks. Of the 480 shark species, only three are responsible for these fatal, unprovoked attacks.
The purple frog spends most of the year underground, surfacing for about two weeks, during the monsoon season, in order to mate.
A mother flamingo's milk is red.
A giraffe's tongue grows to about 21 inches in length.
A garfish has green bones.
Cochineals are small insects from which carminic acid is extracted to make red dye, primarily used in food coloring, and lipstick.
Ostriches do not bury their heads in the sand.
When a hippopotamus stays out of water for too long, it exudes red, sweat-like mucus through its skin, to protect itself from the sun.
In northern Tokyo, a Japanese tavern employs macaque monkeys as waiters.
The teeth of limpets, or sea snails, are the strongest biological material known to man.
A lion's roar can be heard from five miles away.
Iranians arrested 14 squirrels for spying, after discovering they were carrying foreign spy gear.
The male Darwin's frog keeps his tadpoles in his vocal sac until they develop into frogs. He then coughs them up.
Cattle stomachs have four chambers which help break down what they eat.
Male moths can smell female moths from over seven miles away. They do not have noses but detect odor molecules using their antennae.
Termites eat through wood twice as fast when listening to rock music.
Some species of fireflies synchronize their light flashes among large groups.
Worker bees cooperate to find food, using a bee (waggle) dance to communicate information about resources.
The kangaroo rat can run at a speed of 10 feet per second, leap up to 6 feet across and 9 feet up, and switch directions quickly between jumps.
An ant contains two stomachs - one for itself, and one for other ants.
A sword-billed hummingbird can have a beak over four inches long, almost as long as the rest of it's body.
Some queen termites can live up to 50 years and produce over 40,000 eggs a day.
The thorny dragon's scales are ridged, enabling the animal to collect water from any part of its body. That water is then conveyed to its mouth.
Save a Spider Day, celebrated on March 14th, encourages people to appreciate spiders, who eat lots of insects that can spread disease.
Koalas sleep up to 20 hours a day.
Moths are unable to fly during an earthquake.
Hippos can have skin 2.4 inches thick.
Great white sharks have about 3,000 teeth.
Some turtles can breathe through their butts.
Aptostichus barackobamai is a spider named after Barack Obama.
The bonobos, formerly known as pygmy chimpanzees, are exceptionally peaceful apes. They are an endangered species with only 30-50,000 left.
Elephants can communicate by sound waves below normal human hearing. They can also communicate with seismics, vibrations produced by impacts on the earth's surface.
Three bat species, including the common vampire bat, feed solely on blood.
Sometimes octopuses eat their own arms, a behavior probably caused by a virus.
Donkeys are used by the Iraqi military to launch rockets.
More than 99% of all the animal species that have ever lived on earth were extinct before the coming of man.
Mosquito biting activity increases by 500 times during a full moon phase.
The mantis shrimp with smasher claws, can strike so quickly, the resulting shock wave can be enough to kill the prey.
The world's smallest mammal is the bumblebee bat of Thailand, weighing less than a penny.
Dogs produce sweat only where they are not covered with fur, such as the nose and paw pads.
Unlike most species of snakes, Anacondas give birth to live young, instead of laying eggs.
An octopus can squeeze through a one inch hole.
Mother birds will not reject their babies if they have been touched by humans.
Most orangutans have fractured bones, mostly from falling out of trees.
It takes about 12 bees their entire lifetime to make one teaspoon of honey.
Lake Natron, a lake with red water, is the only regular breeding area for the 2.5 million flamingoes in East Africa.
The largest bat in the world, the flying fox, has a wingspan of about six feet.

The mirror test (MSR) is a technique to determine whether an animal has self-recognition. As of 2015, only great apes, dolphins, the Eurasian magpie, some ants, and a single elephant, have passed the MSR.
Slave-maker ants raid nests of other ants, stealing their pupae to provide workers for their own colony.
Butterflies taste with their feet.
Leeches have four brains.
The Tuatara lizard from New Zealand has three eyes. The third eye is on top of its head.
Giant squids have the largest eyes on the planet, the size of soccer balls.
The average person accidentally eats one to two pounds of bugs each year.
About 30-37% of all U.S. households have cats and 37-47% have dogs.
Gilberto Graham rescued a crocodile from the wild, nursing him back to health. They have become friends, swimming, wrestling, and putting on shows together.
Pig by-products include: insulin, suede, gelatin, water filters, rubber, antifreeze, certain plastics, floor waxes, crayons, chalk, shaving creams, soaps, make-up, baked goods, and other foods.
Snails and slugs have teeth, which are arranged in rows along their tongues, and used like a file to saw or slice through food.
A porcupine can repel a group of lions.
Stubbs is a cat who has been the mayor of Talkeetna, Alaska since July 1997.
The giant huntsman spider has the largest leg span, which can reach up to 11 inches.
The polar bear is the largest and most powerful carnivore on land, has no natural predators, and knows no fear of humans,
The animal with the largest brain in proportion to its size is the ant. Some ant species having 14%-15% of their mass, in their brains.
A blue whale calf drinks about 110 gallons of milk a day.
An alligator can regenerate a lost tooth up to 50 times.
Average hummingbirds weigh less than a penny, beat their wings up to 80 times a second, and are the only birds that can fly backwards.
Cicadas can make sounds at up to 120 dB, loud enough to cause permanent hearing loss in humans.
The extinct ancestor of the horse, eohippus, had a short neck and was a bit taller than a normal sized dog.
Lions drink daily when water is available, but they often go without water for 4-5 days.
The mimic octopus has the unique camouflage ability of taking on the color, shape, and texture of various objects and animals.
Some chameleon tongues are more than twice the length of their body excluding the tail.
Sloths sleep 15 to 18 hours per day. Sloths are related to anteaters.
Giant isopods can curl up like roly-polys, though they may reach a length of 14 inches.
Dogs leap to their death from the Overtoun Bridge in Scotland, at a rate of about one per year.
Cats in Halifax and Nova Scotia have a high probability of having six toes.
Kangaroos can jump up to six feet high and leap up to 25 feet.
Mound-building termites build mounds that can have a diameter of 30 yds.
The largest known rodent, the Capybara, can grow up to 4.4 feet in length, and up to two feet in height.
A gifted border collie named Rico has learned the words for more than 200 objects.
Bats are the only mammals that fly.
Flamingos are not naturally pink. They get their color from eating tiny blue-green algae that turn pink during digestion.
A zonkey is a hybrid of a zebra and a donkey.

When his owner was hit by a car, Endal, a service dog, pulled him into recovery position, retrieved his mobile from under the car, fetched a blanket to cover him, and then ran to a nearby hotel to get help.
Tigers that breed with lions give birth to hybrids known as tigons and ligers.
Box jellyfish are almost completely transparent (see-through).
An adult tortoise can survive over a year without access to water, extracting the water it needs from the vegetation it eats.
A lesser short-nosed fruit bat's newborn can be the size of a bumblebee.
Test rats will often choose to help liberate a fellow rat rather than eat a treat.
The name for turkey, the bird, came from European settlers mistakenly thinking that the bird came from Turkey.
To defend themselves, Puss Moth Caterpillars squirt formic acid at the attacker.
Cats have no ability to taste sweet things.
At Bedouin weddings, a whole camel is stuffed with a whole sheep, which is stuffed with chickens, which are stuffed with fish, which are stuffed with eggs.
Calvin Klein's cologne, Obsession for Men, is used on cameras to attract jaguars, pumas and other wildlife.
White cats with blue eyes are usually deaf.
Black panthers are actually leopards and jaguars who have melanism (the opposite of albinism).
Cats have 32 muscles in each ear giving them directional hearing and each ear can move independently.
